it's been *counts fingers* a month and a half since i have been intimate with someone.

i'm practically a virgin again.
Remember "The Nanny"? That's where my jewish grandmother accent comes from. Anyways. This is what it's called in Germany: Could Fran Drescher sue for antisemitism?
Is there anything more beautiful than a rainy, overcast winter's day in Perth?

This is the name of a case I'm studying right now for International Trade Law: Motis Exports v Dampskibsselskabet Dampskibsselskabet... how much is THAT a made up word? Ugh, foreigners... I can so see what happened in court: The judge: "And in the case of Motis Exports and Dampslks... Dampsks.. Dumplstilskin... Dampbshs, oh dude, you SO lose! NEXT!"

Dear Normann and Barbara,

I am currently doing Corporations Law.

I have been studying non stop for a week now, and I spent the day today going through past exams papers.

It took me and another person (who is a very good student) nearly 3 hours to go through the 2005 exam paper. This included just discussing the issues, without writing anything down.

My question to you is how exactly, if at all, are we expected to write an answer to this question in 2 hours and 10 minutes (minus reading time), if it takes 2 people 3 hours to work out the issues?

I look forward to your prompt reply, hopefully before the exam tomorrow morning.

Regards,

Panicked Student #84

*sneaks in*

*whispers*

i'm in the library. i can't study anymore. i just can't. my eyes hurt. my brain hurts. i hate corporations law. and after it's done, i have international trade law to look forward to, which i hate also.

...

where am i?

(googling "define: Milos")

Definitions of Milos on the Web:

Milos (formerly Melos, and before the Athenian genocide Malos) is a volcanic island in the Aegean Sea.
Why did it take me this long to discover Arrested Development???

I have an exam in 9 hours and 20 minutes.

My fingers are cold and I have the shakes. I'm either coming down with something or this is the mind-number fear setting in. When you realise you don't know nuttin 'bout nuttin.

... I hope I get food poisoning from the food I'm about to eat.

Sarah Silverman's standup:

"I only saw my dad naked once. But it's okay, I was only 9... and sooooooo drunk."

"I was raped by a doctor. Which, for a Jewish girl, is a bittersweet experience."

While reading a review of The Da Vinci Code "...And then when Tautou drives backward to get away from some people who would like to kill them in the name of God. She does so like a French female Steve McQueen, dodging all sorts of death on wheels. I sat there thinking, "Well, she's Amelie, so of course that makes her magic"."

I was looking for the lyrics to a song from Wicked, the musical. (cos i'm gay, duh)

stumbled across a website that purported to have the correct ones.

This is what they claimed to be:

"whose the sage, whose savior?
aterararius! making all of us marrier!
whose the sage? who saved me?
tell them to save, artararius!"

The actual lyrics are:

"who's the mage, who's major
itinerary is making all of us merrier!
who's the sage, who sagely
sailed in to save our posteriors!"

....

Who's "aterarirus"?

I now have a new computer and broadband and thus no longer require friends of any kind.

Consider yourselves notified and our respective friendships hereby terminated.

As this advancement in my personal level of technology has also done away with any real need to leave my house, I am also interested in purchasing a large number of cats or snakes, so as to be properly identified as the "Weird Cat/Snake Man Down The Street Who Never Leaves His House".

I was sending off an email, tying up a loose end, romance-wise, from my year away. The romantic endeavour happened in the last few weeks, just before my return to Perth.

The email started well enough, all about the "it was fun while it lasted", "i hope we can be friends!" and all that shit. And then the more I wrote, the more stuff started coming out and I realised that I had convinced myself that this was a casual fling thing, whatever. 

But, it turns out it really wasn't. Why can we never lie to ourselves for long? (or just for long ENOUGH)

By the end of the email, I was sort of panicky and then I sent it off before I got too freaked out and deleted it all.

I don't really "fall" (or even stumble) for people very easily and definitely not at all often. Sure, I'm attracted to a fair amount of people (i DO have SOME standards), but it usually fizzles remarkably quickly. And yes, that it had to happen just before my return to Perth is annoying.

But so is the fact that I had almost gotten away with convincing myself it didn't mean anything to me. Well it did. And now I'm angry and wishing he was here so I could bury my head in his nook (you know, between his chin and shoulder) and smell him. I really miss being able to smell him.

Fuck this shit.

I need stimulants.

okaaaay! I returns to Perth on January 3rd, which is like a week later than originally planned, and means I will miss Breakfest but also means a flight that is NOT 5 days long, but 16 hours, which is good. I'm enrolled in 2006, doing the following units: Corporations Law Admin 1 Conflict of Laws International Trade Law Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Law 2nd semester (which I most likely won't be doing in 2006, but 2007)) Con Law 2 Evidence Admin 2 Mining and Energy Law Banking Law A VERY CUNNING PLAN by Milos Stage 1) Approved Leave for semester 2 2006 Stage 2) Schedule Procedure, Conveyancing and Drafting and the 2 Honours Units for 2008 The above leaving you with: 2007 being a part-time year Stage 3) Take some time off to relax and recharge, possibly by performing an elaborate interpretive dance in honour of the Goddess. Stage 4) By cleverly manipulating the space-time continuum, all of the units you need and want to do in 2007 are in 2nd semester. THUS You have no units in 1st semester 2007, WHICH Combined with Stage 1 above RESULTS IN Having no work whatsoever from June 2006 until August 2007. MILOS: 1; THE SYSTEM: ZERO. Of course, this is all geared for me doing Law honours. If I decide to do ARTS honours instead.... well... that's a whole different story then. One that is far more complicated and involves extensive use of Time-Turners. Or else leaving uni some time in my mid-40s. Not too fussed though. I don't actually want to do anything apart from work for the UN, and all I need to for that is to get my Masters in SOMETHING by the time I'm 32.

I've been growing my fringe from non-existant (in December last year) to this lenght. and this is what i look like RIGHT now: I'm cutting my hair today!!!!!!!! --------- decisions for next year: 1) acting lessons - i've always stayed away from things i suck at, even if i enjoyed doing them... i used to like acting when i was like 10, you know that age when you don't need to be good, just cute and grownups go "AWWW, YOU'RE SO GOOD!" but what they really mean is "AWW, YOU'RE SO CUTE IN YOUR LITTLE BEE COSTUME!". But cute just don't cut it anymore! So i've not been acting [bar the Smerfs appearance and the now-let-us-never-speak-of-it-again Indian Ink]. so i figure i want to do something I like again. 2) gym - i need the energy and the endorphins and, yes, the strength to punch through brick walls. who doesn't in this day and age? 3) no drugs 4) some vague notion about burning down the Law School building I think this will do for now.
The only, ONLY relevant thing about this movie is Cedric Diggory.

Barcelona is amazing. LOOK UP "GAUDI" IF YOU'VE NEVER SEEN ANY OF HIS WORKS!!! The Sagrada Familia... drooool.... met this american guy (and he was SOOOO american, not to overgeneralise). he spoke spanish, but did so with the STRONGEST american accent (you know the way they say "no problemo" *shudder*). anyways. he goes to me: "What's Absynth?" i gasped, clutched my pearls and screamed at him to get away from my table.

This year's first snow.

Which makes me all the more glad that I'm leaving for Barcelona this afternoon. I was not built for cold weather.

Gaudi, Dali and hot, steamy Spanish men, however, is EXACTLY what I was built for.

Got back from Brussels and London last night. Seeing Hanna was more fun than fun camp and Belgium is by far the most decadently wealthy country I've been to. Everyone's rich. And they've always been rich. They're historical buildings are so opulently decorated they're bordering on tacky. Some ARE downright tacky. "Flemish High Gothic" style, in Hanna's words: "What? We were rich and we wanted to show it!". Yes, not tacky at all.

London was crazy fun. A big blurry blur of fun and shopping.

I'm tired of travelling. I hate suitcases and packing and packing. I want to sleep for the next 10 days.

It's getting cold and the days are really short now. I want sun and sunbathing and warmth.

On the other hand, it's scary to think I'll be home in 2 months.

I'm off to Belgium on Monday.

Gonna finally do that Backstreet Boys Reunion Concert with Hanna. And gorge on chocolate. And explore the "Continental Pearl", which apparently means Belgium in the mind of that insane little milkmaid.

Then go on to London, to catch up with Stephen and partay heartay. Meanwhoile. I've been doing not enough of that in the last 3 weeks. If all goes well, gonna see valentino canziani tonight, who spun at EXIT right before Carl Cox (which means something only to Luke and Nick 3.14). 

My dad arrives tomorrow. I haven't seen him since I left Perth. That is, January 1st. It's bizzare thinking it's been that long. But anyway. Dad gets here tomorrow and then I flee the country on Monday. That's like 36 hours to spend with him. But OK, i'll see him when i return from London. He's the kind of guy who would understand that. He's also the kind of guy who was swindled by an unscrupulous son (prodigal son?) into paying for a flight to Brussels from Belgrade instead of one from Budapest which was a lot cheaper, because said son couldn't be arsed getting all the way to Budapest.

I've been naughty in many ways in many places often and a lot.
AND NOW I CAN'T STOP SMILING AND BURYING MY FACE IN MY HANDS AND GIGGLING

Reading Margaret Atwood's The Blind Assassin. She's so at ease with expression and language. She is to writing what extasy is to inhibitions. It was Colonerl Parkman who upped stakes, crossed the border, and named our town, thus perversely commemorating a battle in which he'd lost. (Though perhaps that's not so unusual: many people take a curatorial interest in their own scars.)

tonight i paid the penultimate price for a night of hard and heavy partying. i had my favorite jacket stolen at the Shadow Lounge in SOHO. To whoever stole my black jacket with the gray print on the lapels and the front and my buttons from paris and the 2 brand now Camden "I LOVE WOMEN" and "I HATE GIRLS" buttons: YOU ARE SCUM. YOU ARE THE LOWEST OF THE LOW, YOU FUCKING CUNTRAG. CURSE UPON YOUR WRETCHED SOUL, AND UPON THE SOULS OF YOUR ANCESTORS AND DESCENDENTS. MAY YOU FUCKING BURN IN HELL FOR ALL ETERNITY. THAT JACKET WAS MY FAVOURITE PIECE OF CLOTHING, IT HAS PARTIED ON 3 CONTINENTS AND SEEN SOME OF THE FUNNEST NIGHTS OF MY LIFE. YOU FUCKING PIECE OF DOGSHIT, GO MOTHERFUCKING FUCK YOURSELF. I HOPE YOU FUCKING DIE IN THE WORST FUCKING TORMENTS. FUUUUUUUUUUUCK YOOOOOOOOOOU!!!!! I can't believe that it is possible to miss an inanimate object this much.
for Dan W's viewing pleasure... meet Stephen yes, he's missing the upper right side of his face. he lost it in a terrible hot air balloon accident when he was 6.

So, succeeded in making a complete fool of myself last night.

We went to a friend's birthday party and I knew that Stephen's ex boyfriend of 3 years, whom I'd never met, was going to be there. NOW, I have NO problem with exes.

Unless of course those exes happen to be tall, buff, really goodlooking, confident and extremely sociable and friendly hi-power corporate lawyers who used to play rugby for Oxford.

He went out of his way to be really friendly and he seems like a GENUINELY nice guy, which of course only made me feel more threatened, which I HATED cos I fucking NEVER feel threatened in these situations!

So what do I do?

I hit the tequila. And the vodka. And the gin. And it all goes south from there. I blacked out around 1.30am, when Stephen had to take me home.

I hate this. I hate that Stephen totally realised why I was so insecure.

BUT... I felt better (if no less MORTIFIED) by the end of the night.

Stephen took me home, took care of me, put me to bed, made me drink lots of water and while I was belting "Waltzing Matilda", made me eggs on toast at 2.30am, so the grease would suck up the alcohol, all the while being really understanding. And this morning, we had a bit of a laugh about it all...

I guess he must like me, cos nothing says true love like carrying your drunken lover home and making him eggs at 2.30am...

oh, and there's also been this... High up above or down below when you're too in love to let it go If you never try you'll never know Just what you're worth Lights will guide you home and ignite your bones And I will try to fix you and fucking hell, Goldfrapp's SUPERNATURE rocks some serious socks.

In London, finally, for just over a week now. It's been really really really good! I've thrown caution to the wind and dived into a relationship, and it actually makes me happy. I'm not freaking out or anything, which... yeah, definitely a step up! Known him for about 2 months now and it just feels ... easy and unforced... and fun. I've been exploring this beautiful city, hanging out with amazing people... Even a little taste of Perth today - just had coffee/lunch with Cat! We browsed the whole of Camden Markets for goodies, but were disappointed for the most of it. "Camden stopped being cutting-edge several thousand cheap leather jackets ago." I'm 100% glad that I ended up coming to London because I'm now 100% sure that I don't want to stay. It's strange, having wanted this so much at one point to now realise that I don't really want to be here. In fact, the only reason I ended up coming was Stephen. And as amazing as that relationship is, and as much as I would want that to be enough, it just isn't. I'm just not the kind of person who can be happy with any sort of situation, as long as they're with someone they ... love... or care for, or whatever. Stephen has been amazing and understanding and caring, and I've never felt this way about anyone before. But in the end... I'm not ready to put my life on hold just so I could be with him. Am I simply not built for relationships, being too selfish and self-absorbed? Maybe. Definitely maybe. But I can't go against what I know I want. Not for him, not for anyone. Travel Plans So, on the 19th, I'm going off to Paris for some time with Nay (PISS OFF YA GROTTY LITTLE WANKER!!!!), then to Copenhagen with Stephen, Jimmy and Michelle and then to Germany. And then to Spain with my sister (actually really looking forward to travelling with her) and then then then the ULTIMATE the UNBEATABLE going to Brussels to once again bask in the presence of one of the funnest human beings around - La Belge. I have missed her so much, having last seen her in New York (where she made a point of congradulating some random New Yorker on how impressive she found the Empire State Building to be...). We are going to the Backstreet Boys reunion concert. It will be the ultimate post-Canada experience... Some of the funnest times this year included La Belge, Suza, The German, Nic, Micheal and me in the confined space of a minivan/karaoke room at The Marble Arch, belting out the BB classics, and spicing them up with some Avril and N'Stink. *wipes tear* I have a plan: Me and Hanna (La Belge's actual name...), front row for the Backstreet Boys, screaming "DO NOBODY'S HOME!!! DO NOBODY'S HOME!!!!" at the band, who will be standing there confused, wondering if they actually have a song called NOBODY'S HOME, as the two of us are being dragged away by the riot police, kicking and screaming. Goooooood times. Summary Looking back on the whole Vancouver experience. Fuck that was awesome. Some of the most amazing, kind, beautiful people I've ever met. And a decent number of them are in Perth now, which makes me a very happy camper. Looking back at my time spent in Serbia... a drug-induced haze, but I guess that's what summer is for, right? London... yeah, definitely glad I came here, definitely glad i'm exploring this amazing place and definitely sure there's not enough for me here right now. The next 4 months... *big wide grin*

Summer days... 2 weeks ago, summer finally arrived, weather-wise. Again. And it's been amazing... warm, balmy, hot, boiling, then sleepless nights from the heat. Moist skin, thick air, opaque eventualities.

I got my UK visa on Monday (2 year Working Holidaymaker one) and now all that's left to do is buy a ticket, pack and leave.

... and I'm not sure what I want to do. Had you asked me a month ago, I definitely fucking did. In many ways, EXIT was a peak and a low. About a week after it, having overcome a bout of you-know-which post-partying feelings, everything started changing for the better. I really like it here now. I'm actually having fun with cool people.

And I really wanted to go to London. And I really don't know now. It seems, of course, like something I've been wanting for a while. And it seems like I'm letting myself down if I don't do it.

I'm torn between:

a) I want to go to London but it's easier to stay here where everything's familiar and not bother

OR

b) I want to go to London but I want to stay here more, because I am actually having fun here for the first time ever and am not (also for the first time ever) looking forward to leaving

I don't know which one it is.

I don't want to stay here just because it's easier and I don't want to go to London just because it's something I wanted before and something I SHOULD want.

However, having said all this, I'm not a ball of anxiety... I know I'll make the right decision... maybe a compromise (go to London but come back and spend more time here). Either way, I will do what i WANT to do, not what I think i SHOULD do. It's just that right now I'm not sure what I WANT to do, which is so ANNOYING because for once, I decide to go with my instincts and that's exactly the moment they stop being... instincty.

On Serbia's top flavour-enhancer spice thingo:

"At LEAST 15% MSG!"

I thought of a Panda...
Reading Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince. Currently at the last paragraph of page 64 of the adult edition. I would just like to state for the record: I SEE IT COMING.

Here's some photos from the 2nd night of EXIT - Garbage, of course. The only good photo, you can hardly see Shirley, but MAN. Was she there!!! I've said this before, and I'll say it again: she could turn me. 7am the morning after, making our way home (still in the fortress though). Broken, broken, broken. And muddy. 7am the morning after. A broken man. A broken, sweaty, smelly, satisfied man.

My body is a temple. That was last week pillaged and burnt down by the invading barbarians. After a week of INTENSE hedonism, I had a total emotional/physical breakdown on Tuesday, after seeing Luke off. I got home, backed my little bag and ran out of town, to my auntie's house, where I've done nothing but sleep and eat for 3 days now. No plan to do much else soon. EXIT was brilliant, though it brought to the surfice an issue I've been refusing to deal with for a while (well, ever since it became an issue). But, no more. When the body went "OH MY GOD, I'M IMPLODING!!!!", it was time to stop. A week later it still has me exhausted and with sporadic nasty headaches and depression. Done and done with it. The ABSOLUTE highpoint of EXIT: Day 2, midnight. Garbage is meant to come on in half an hour. A MOTHERFUCKER of a storm comes out of nowhere, it's raining turds, the giant main stage gets completely soaked and almost blown away. People start leaving, I start panicking. An hour and a half later, we're still standing there, FROZEN from the COLD and the WET, when they finally grace us with an announcement: "The band is willing to perform, but the entire stage, and all their equipement, is wet. We'll see what we can do." Half an hour later, they come on and play one of the best sets I've ever heard. Flawless playing and singing (SHIRLEY MANSON!!!), so much eneregy! These guys aren't just musicians, they're performers as well and they really knew how to engage the audience and have a blast. The moment of moments: Shirley: "This one's for you crazy motherfuckers who stood out here waiting for us for two motherfucking hours. I'm singing in the rain Just singing in the rain I don't know the fucking lyrics but hell, i'll make them up just singing, and dancing in the rain! *beat, beat, beat, beat, beat* I'm only happy when it rains... BAAAAM!!!!! Crowd goes WILD - one of the best things I've ever seen in my life. My angsty teen years wish has been fulfilled. I saw Garbage live.

Never been a huge fan of Ani DiFranco, but she was the musical guest on the episode of Conan O'Brien we saw in NYC and i loved her song. Finally managed to find it - i really really like it.

decree

step up and forfeit your frontal lobe 
to the sexed up stroll of celebrity 
never mind that the nanoseconds in between
are some of the darkest darkness that you've ever seen
keep your eye on my finger
and listen to the sound of my voice 

get your subliminal decree
and your false security 
be all that you can be
be all that you can be

in hospitals and schools
airports and banks and bars 
big ones on street corners
little ones driving by in cars
and glowing through countless 
bedroom curtains at night 
that 30k tone 
and that pale blue light saying 

daddy knows best
yes, this is the news 
in 90 second segments officially produced 
and aired again and again and again 
by the little black and white pawns 
of the network yes men
while the stars are going out 
and the stripes are getting bent

and cancer, the great teacher 
has been opening schools
downstream from every factory 
still, everywhere fools 
are squinting into microscopes
researching cells 
trying to figure out a way
that we can all live in hell

well, step back, look up
you'll see i'm dimming the sun
but you won't, will you?
oh, that's a good little one 

'cause daddy knows best 
yes, this is the news 
in 90 second segments officially produced 
and aired again and again and again 
by the little black and white pawns 
of the network yes men
while the stars are going out 
and the stripes are getting bent

the stars are going out 
and the stripes are getting bent

Today was such a lovely day (after a week of CONTINUOUS rain), so I took the camera and went out. I'm not happy about the sun in my eyes, BUT -> THIS IS THE FORTRESS THAT WILL HOUSE EXIT IN LESS THAN A MONTH!!!! YAAAAAAAAY! as is visible, it's on a hill across the river from Novi Sad It's pretty cool even now, I walked around where the various stages will be (the Dance Arena [where all the top DJs will be performing] is a huge valley surrounded by high fortress-y walls and connected with the rest of the place by a long tunnel. ENDLESSLY cool. I HAVE A BIG HEAD - THE THING NEXT TO MY HEAD IS A YUGO!!!!!!!! Me as a blonde: YAY OR NAY?

The biggest news from Holywood: RENT, the movie, is coming out in November. Apart from Rosario Dawson starring as Mimi, the rest are all Broadway cast. It will be the 2nd most important cinematic event of the year, after, of course, the September premiere of Serenity.

Some North American shots: Me and Polly (a gem of a Melbourne girl) in Alphabet City in Manhattan, in front of what would have once been the building from Rent I took a daytrip to Montauk, which is where Jim Carrey goes to at the beginning of Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. Thus: The beach which Jim Carrey walks on. Montauk is on the very edge of Long Island. So little and quiet. The end of the Long Island Railroad Satisfying to voyer in me. Life's prettier when seen through reeds.

A little snippet of the EXIT lineup: Underworld, Dave Clark, 2 Many DJs, Felix da housecat Garbage, Carl Cox Fatboy Slim, Sasha, Evil Nine The White Stripes As Summer from The OC would say, "I AM VIBRATING AT A VERY HIGH FREQUENCY!"

On the plane from New York, I got lectured by this dirt-farming Dorothy about how I shouldn't be a vegetarian because it takes away from the livelyhood of American cattle farmers. She was completely emo about it, like "A lot of my friends raise cattle, and you know.... *meaningful look*". My heart breaks for the American cow-killers. And the cow in the meadow goes "moo" And the cow in the meadow goes "moo" and then the farmer hits her on the head and cuts her up and that's how we get hamburgers!

Boston is depressing, in the sense that it's exactly what Perth COULD be, but isn't and probably never will be. It's a smallish city (the size of perth or a bit smaller), but perfectly designed, and with actual human beings roaming the streets and the many cafes and shopping areas.

We hired a car yesterday and drove up to Salem (did you know that the Witch Hysteria of 1692 was all due to LSD? Apparently, they only crop that survived the really harsh weather was infected with this fungus that has the basic LSD element in it. They couldn't throw it out cos they had nothing else to eat. So everyone was tripping!), and then down to Providence (we went to Brown University, one of the Ivy League schools. I always knew I'd get there somehow), and then up to Cape Cod where we dined at the restaurant that the Kennedy's frequent in the summer. Though we were somewhat less classy, I daresay.

I have to say, one of the most bizzare dates EVER. The other night, I went out with this guy who seemed cool, but who then turned out to be a high-power lawyer for a big corporate law firm. OK, we're all attracted to power, but at one point I started thinking he's a bit up himself (and coming from me, that's saying something, right?). And then he whips out his business card (no, that's not a penis metaphore), don't ask me why, and it looked EXACTLY like the cards that Christian Bale, Jared Leto and the other wankers compare in American Psycho. The colour, the simple blank font, the no-graphics, it WAS on of the American Psycho cards!!! He then commented on the font and how subtle the relief work on the card is. And then chuckled at the obvious connection with American Psycho. CHUCKLED. He was like "Yeah, that's the way it is, all the big clients want you to have cards like this, because they throw out any cards that have the slightest bit of graphic on them. And when American Psycho came out, we were all like 'Oh, no, now everbody knows!' *chuckle, chuckle*" And, apparently "We compare our business cards over lunch ALL the time! *chuckle, chuckle*" And all I could think of was "Oh dear lord, I am going to get a power drill put through my brain tonight!" I kept the card and as soon as I find a scanner I am going to post it. It is fucking CREEPY. *shudder*

We saw RENT last night. Without a doubt the best musical I've seen. Ever. Rivetting, enthralling, confronting - all those words that a critic would use, and also incredibly human, depressing and uplifting. An experience. Cannot recommend it highly enough. Even people who normally wouldn't enjoy musicals loved it. We had front row seats and later I saw the guy who played Tom Collins and he recognized me before I recognized him! He was like "Hey, front row! Did you enjoy it?" and I swooned and giggled like a schoolgirl. Today I'm going to Wicked, currently the top Broadway musical, but I honestly don't know if I'll enjoy it as much. It seems to be an excellent piece of musical theatre, but not in the same way as RENT. It's the story of young, bright and ambitious green-skinned girl who will grow up to become the Wicked Witch of the West. We have amazing seats, and I'm going in with an open mind. But RENT just affected me so much. Gay people, AIDS, Bohemians, NEW YORK. New York's been amazing thus far, and it seems things will keep getting better...

The Belgian: "Oh my god, I met BRENDAN FLOWERS from The Killers at the Arch on Saturday!!!! It was SOOO amazing!!!!! The drunken German introduced us and we're in love and I've decided that I'm having his lovechild. I'm gonna name it Rose. Do you like that?? ROSE FLOWERS!!!!!! Oh, I think I'm going a bit mad... well, I'm already.. well nevermind!" Some people are just born to make you smile forever.
